data.title: Carl Sagan Book List
data.meta_description: A complete list of all Carl Sagan's books in order (9 books). Browse plot descriptions, book covers, genres, pseudonyms, ratings and awards.

Pulitzer Prize-winning author and astronomer Carl Sagan imagines the greatest adventure of all -- the discovery of an advanced civilization in the depths of space.In December of 1999, a multinational team journeys out to the stars, to the most awesom...

The Dragons of Eden; Speculations on the Evolution of Human Intelligence

Jan-1987

/ Science Fiction

“A history of the human brain from the big bang, fifteen billion years ago, to the day before yesterday . . . It's a delight.” -- The New York Times

Dr. Carl Sagan takes us on a great reading adventure, offering his vivid and startling ins...

Shadows of Forgotten Ancestors

Sep-1993

/ General Fiction

"Dazzling...A feast. Absorbing and elegantly written, it tells of theorigins of life on earth, describes its variety and charaacter, and culminates in a discussion of human nature and teh complex traces ofhumankind's evolutionary past...It is an amaz...
